2008-03-18.snippet: HIGHER FARES, AGAIN Another sweeping fare increase by major domestic airlines seemed to be holding on Monday even after United Airlines and Continental Airlines partly rolled back some of their increases over the weekend, said Rick Seaney, the chi...
2008-03-18.lead_paragraph: HIGHER FARES, AGAIN Another sweeping fare increase by major domestic airlines seemed to be holding on Monday even after United Airlines and Continental Airlines partly rolled back some of their increases over the weekend, said Rick Seaney, the chief executive officer of FareCompare.com. The rise in prices, the fourth this year, was initiated late last week by United Airlines, which raised fares $50 on round-trip routes of over 1,500 miles each way. United’s competitors among the six so-called legacy carriers followed with similar increases over the weekend. Mr. Seaney said that the scattered rollbacks of the increases on some routes appeared to be responses to “normal competitive pressure” rather than a signal of a broad retreat from the increases.

2008-03-25.snippet: PREMIUM AIR TRAVEL SAGS Premium traffic, which had been increasing robustly around the world in recent years, “is now slowing sharply,” said the International Air Transport Association, noting that the number of passengers traveling globally i...
2008-03-25.lead_paragraph: PREMIUM AIR TRAVEL SAGS Premium traffic, which had been increasing robustly around the world in recent years, “is now slowing sharply,” said the International Air Transport Association, noting that the number of passengers traveling globally in first- and business-class seats “barely grew” in January compared with January 2007. Premium traffic on the lucrative trans-Atlantic routes grew 5.6 percent in 2007, and was 2.6 percent higher in January compared with January 2007. But that represented slowing compared with December, when trans-Atlantic premium traffic rose 5.7 percent over December 2006. Premium traffic to and from the Middle East continued to grow unabated, with a 20.6 percent increase last year, the international airline trade group said. Continental Airlines has announced a sharp reduction in 60-day advance-purchase business-class fares to Europe for the summer. Here’s a sample round-trip fare: Newark-London Heathrow, $1,798 plus taxes and fees.
